A **rakuyo** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a one-handed weapon composed of a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") and a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), latched together at their pommels and pointing in opposite directions. It is made of [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal"), uses the saber [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") and appears as a **double-bladed saber** when unidentified.

The [Blade Singer's Saber](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Blade_Singer.27s_Saber "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") rakuyo.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

  - [2.1 Rakuyo-saber](#Rakuyo-saber)
  - [2.2 Rakuyo-dagger](#Rakuyo-dagger)
  - [2.3 Rakuyo property](#Rakuyo_property)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

## Generation

Rakuyos and their component weapons are not randomly generated, though they can be found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") or [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for.

## Description

Rakuyos deal piercing and slashing damage, and can be [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison"). They do not gain any damage bonus from the wielder's [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), but do gain a damage bonus equal to twice the wielder's [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity"). While wielded and not [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), a rakuyo's enchantment is effectively doubled and it gains +1d3 damage against small monsters and +1d4 against large monsters, but attacking with one uses up an extra 3 movement points.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a wielded rakuyo will unlatch the weapon into its component parts and begin [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweaponing "Twoweaponing"):

### Rakuyo-saber

The **rakuyo-saber** is the weapon produced in your main hand when unlatching a rakuyo. It uses the saber skill, and appears as a **latch-pommeled saber** when unidentified. A rakuyo-saber is nearly identical to a regular rakuyo, minus the [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") of the unlatched dagger.

The Blade Singer's Saber retains its identity while unlatched.

### Rakuyo-dagger

The **rakuyo-dagger** is the weapon produced in your off-hand when unlatching a rakuyo, and uses the dagger skill, allowing it to be thrown with no [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") penalty. It appears as a **latch-pommeled dagger** when unidentified. Like the main saber, rakuyo-daggers deal piercing and slashing damage and can be poisoned, and also lack a strength bonus while gaining a doubled dexterity bonus.

The [Blade Dancer's Dagger](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Blade_Dancer.27s_Dagger "DNetHack artifacts") is the artifact that accompanies the Blade Singer's Saber, and only appears when unlatched from the latter.

### Rakuyo property

"Rakuyo" is also the name of an [object property](/wiki/Object_properties#dNetHack "Object properties") that all rakuyos and their components possess; [yuki-onna](/wiki/Yuki-onna_\(starting_race\) "Yuki-onna (starting race)") [Madwomen](/wiki/Madwomen "Madwomen") can also find a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana") and [wakizashi](/wiki/Wakizashi "Wakizashi") with this property in the [Madman quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest").

Rakuyo weapons are [insight weapons](/wiki/Insight_weapons "Insight weapons") and gain additional to-hit and damage dice when used by Madmen or any role with [Ose](/wiki/Ose "Ose") bound: these bonuses scale with the character's [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight") and [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"). Rakuyo weapons also gain additional properties for any character using them, depending on insight:

- At 20 insight, they become "blood-drenched", which causes damage to hostile monsters behind a monster that you attack in melee.
- At 40 insight, they become "burning", and attacking a monster in melee causes 3x3 explosions of [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") centered on the square behind the target.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Add details on how much damage these effects do, etc."*

## Origin

The rakuyo originates from *[Bloodborne](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloodborne "wikipedia:Bloodborne")*, a video game developed by FromSoftware - the extra blood and fire effects of weapons with the rakuyo property at high insight are based on attacks performed by Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower, a boss that wields a rakuyo during her fight.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Rakuyo\&action=edit)*
